title: Simplify the Expression
text: To isolate the variable, first subtract both sides by one to get $$4x^2=6$$
speech: To isolate the variable, first subtract both sides by one to get , 4 x squared, is equal to 6

title: Simplify the Expression
speech: Next, divide both sides by 4: , x squared is equal to 6 fourths .

title: Square Root
text: Take the +/- square root of both sides: $$x=\pm \sqrt{\frac{6}{4}}$$.
speech: Take the +/- square root of both sides:  x is equal to, plus or minus, the square root of 6 fourths end root .

title: Square Root
text: $$\sqrt{6}$$ is in its simplest form, so we can leave it as it is. $$\sqrt{4}=2$$, so the final answer is $$\frac{\pm \sqrt{6}}{2}$$
speech: the square root of 6  is in its simplest form, so we can leave it as it is.  the square root of 4 is equal to 2 , so the final answer is  fraction, plus or minus, the square root of 6 over 2,
